description: From French métamorphoser, from Old French metamorphose, from Latin metamorphōsis; see metamorphosis.

verbs.description: metamorphose (third-person singular simple present metamorphoses, present participle metamorphosing, simple past and past participle metamorphosed)

entries.meaning: (of a moth or insect, intransitive) To undergo metamorphosis.
(by extension, intransitive) To undergo some transformation.
(transitive) To transform (something) so that it has a completely different appearance.
